resources.string:
Liar's Dice is a game where you bet on the minimum number of dice of a certain value. 

Each player has a cup containing at most 6 dice. 

Each player upturns their cup onto the table and peaks at the values of their own rolled dice. 

Betting then commences. Full details on the rules can be found at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liar's_dice.

Set the value of the slider to the number of dice that are not visible to you on the table. 

The graph plots out the probabilities that there will be at least m dice of a given face value in addition to those under your own cup. 

m can be any number up to the total number of dice that are not visible to you. 

Note that the probabilities drop of very rapidly. 

It is worth baring in mind that you expect one sixth of the unseen dice to have a given face value. 

The probability of at least this number of dice is always just over 50%.
